overview.title: 1. Project Overview
overview.p1: The GPTK Library Management System is a comprehensive software solution designed to modernize the library operations of Government Polytechnic, Kampli. It aims to replace manual record-keeping with an efficient, digital system.
overview.p2: The primary purpose of this system is to streamline the cataloging, circulation, and tracking of library resources. It solves the problems of time-consuming manual searches, error-prone fine calculations, and lack of real-time inventory status.
overview.p3: Target users include Librarians, Staff, and Students.

objectives.title: 2. Objectives
list: To automate the issuance and return of books.
To provide a searchable digital catalog for students and staff.
To generate accurate reports on circulation and fines.
To ensure data security and role-based access control.

declaration.title: 4. Declaration / Copyright
declaration.text: This project is developed strictly for academic purposes as part of the curriculum. © {{year}} Dept of CS&E, GPT Kampli. All rights reserved.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.header: Welcome to GPTK Library Management System
intro.desc: The <1>GPTK Library Management System (LMS)</1> is a state-of-the-art desktop application meticulously designed to digitize and automate the entire workflow of the Government Polytechnic Kampli library. Built for speed, reliability, and ease of use, it transforms traditional library operations into a seamless digital experience.
intro.tip_release: <1>Release 1.0:</1> Now featuring a completely redesigned interface with dark mode support, enhanced reporting analytics, and automated student data imports.
intro.core_desc: Designed to serve librarians, faculty, and students, the system integrates five key pillars of library management:
intro.core_catalog: <1>Catalog Management:</1> A powerful search and inventory system for thousands of books.
intro.core_circ: <1>Smart Circulation:</1> Lightning-fast issue/return process using barcode scanning or manual entry.
intro.core_admin: <1>Member Administration:</1> Comprehensive student and staff databases with digital ID card generation.
intro.core_finance: <1>Financial Tracking:</1> Automated fine calculation, due date management, and transaction logging.
intro.core_insights: <1>Actionable Insights:</1> Real-time dashboards and detailed PDF/Excel reports for decision-making.
intro.nav_desc: The interface is divided into two main areas for maximum productivity:
intro.nav_sidebar: <1>The Sidebar:</1> Located on the left, this is your primary navigation menu to access different modules like Books, Students, and Settings.
intro.nav_dash: <1>The Dashboard:</1> Your home screen, displaying vital statistics like total books, active issues, and overdue alerts at a glance.
intro.fig_dash: Figure 1: Main Dashboard with Key Performance Indicators

auth.title: Authentication
auth.desc: The system employs extensive security protocols to ensure that sensitive library data remains protected while offering seamless access to authorized personnel.
auth.sec_note: <1>Security Note:</1> The application uses industry-standard encryption for passwords and maintains a secure, local-first database environment.
auth.rbac_desc: Access is strictly controlled through a <1>Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)</1> system. Your dashboard experience automatically adapts based on your assigned credentials:
auth.role_admin: <1>Admins:</1> Full system control including settings, staff management, and audit logs.
auth.role_staff: <1>Staff:</1> Operational access for circulation and member management, restricted from critical system configs.
auth.role_lib: <1>Librarians:</1> Dedicated view for cataloging and day-to-day library operations.
auth.feat_lock: <1>Auto-Lock:</1> Sessions automatically lock after 15 minutes of inactivity.
auth.feat_show: <1>Show/Hide Password:</1> Toggle visibility to prevent typo errors.
auth.feat_enter: <1>Enter Key Support:</1> Press 'Enter' to instantly submit credentials.
auth.otp_desc: Forgot your credentials? The system includes a secure, OTP-based recovery mechanism to restore access without admin intervention.
auth.step_click: Click <1>Forgot Password?</1> on the login screen.
auth.step_enter: Enter your registered <1>Email Address</1>. The system verifies this against the staff database.
auth.step_otp: Receive a <1>6-digit OTP</1> (One-Time Password) via email.
auth.step_new: Enter the OTP to authenticate and create a new <1>High-Strength Password</1>.

setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.desc: Welcome to the GPTK Library Management System. Upon first launch, the application initiates a comprehensive <1>System Health Check</1> and guides you through the essential configuration steps to prepare the database for production use.
setup.tip_net: <1>Pro Tip:</1> Ensure your system is connected to the local network if you plan to enable multi-terminal access immediately.
setup.db_desc: The system automatically detects the local environment and initializes the SQLite database. It verifies write permissions and creates the necessary directory structures for:
setup.admin_desc: The first account created possesses <1>Super Admin</1> privileges, granting immutable access to all system-critical settings. This account cannot be deleted, only deactivated.
setup.step_launch: <1>Launch Application:</1> Open the <2>GPTK-LMS.exe</2> executable. The system detects a fresh install.
setup.step_id: <1>Identity Verification:</1> Enter the full legal name of the Chief Librarian or Administrator.
setup.step_cred: <1>Credential Setup:</1> Define a secure password (min. 8 chars, alphanumeric).
setup.step_shake: <1>System Handshake:</1> Click <2>"Initialize System"</2>. The app will perform a 5-second handshake to write the schema and seed default data.
setup.warn_close: <1>Important:</1> Do not force close the application during the "System Handshake" phase, as this may corrupt the initial database schema.

dashboard.title: The Dashboard
dashboard.desc: The Dashboard serves as the command center of the GPTK Library Management System, offering a real-time panoramic view of library operations and instant access to all modules.
dashboard.sidebar_desc: Located on the left, the collateral sidebar is organized into logical clusters for intuitive workflow:
dashboard.circ_desk: <1>Circulation Desk:</1> Daily issue/return operations and transaction logs.
dashboard.admin_tools: <1>Administrative:</1> Staff management, System Health, and Global Settings.
dashboard.tip_nav: <1>Quick Nav:</1> The sidebar can be collapsed to maximize screen real estate on smaller displays.
dashboard.live_desc: Upon login, you are greeted with a visual summary of the library's current pulse. The dashboard aggregates data from various modules to provide actionable insights.
dashboard.kpi_books: <1>Total Books:</1> Live count of unique titles in the catalog.
dashboard.kpi_active: <1>Active Members:</1> Number of registered students and staff.
dashboard.kpi_velocity: <1>Circulation Velocity:</1> Total books issued within the current 24-hour cycle.
dashboard.kpi_overdue: <1>Overdue Alerts:</1> (Not shown in mock) Highlights books that are past their expected return date.

header.title: Header & Settings
header.desc: The <1>Header</1> provides global settings and user controls at the top of the screen.
header.lang: <1>Language:</1> Toggle between English and Kannada interface.
header.font: <1>Font Size:</1> Adjust text size for better readability.
header.theme: <1>Theme:</1> Switch between Light and Dark modes.
header.profile: <1>User Profile:</1> Access account settings or Logout.
header.dash_desc: The <1>Dashboard</1> provides a real-time snapshot of library operations.
header.kpi_total: <1>Total Books:</1> Count of all books in the catalog.
header.kpi_issued: <1>Issued Today:</1> Books issued in the last 24 hours.
header.kpi_pending: <1>Overdue:</1> Books pending return past their due date.

books.title: Book Catalog
books.desc: The <1>Book Catalog</1> is the heart of your library, serving as a centralized database for all physical and digital resources. It offers powerful tools to add, organize, and track your entire collection with precision.
books.dash_desc: The main interface provides a bird's-eye view of your inventory, featuring advanced filtering and bulk action capabilities.
books.search: <1>Smart Search:</1> Instantly locate books by Title, Author, ISBN, or even Publisher.
books.filters: <1>Dynamic Filters:</1> Sort by Category (e.g., Engineering), Status (Available/Issued), or Language.
books.actions: <1>Quick Actions:</1> Edit details, manage copies, or delete records directly from the list view.
books.add_desc: You can add books individually or in bulk. The system checks for duplicate ISBNs to prevent redundancy.
books.step_add: Click <1>Add Book</1> to open the registration form.
books.step_scan: <1>ISBN Scanning:</1> Use a barcode scanner to auto-fill the ISBN field.
books.step_meta: <1>Metadata:</1> Enter Title, Author, Publisher, and Edition.
books.step_cat: <1>Categorization:</1> Assign a Department and Shelf Location for easy retrieval.
books.bulk_desc: Ideal for migrating legacy data. Download the template, fill it via Excel, and upload.
books.bulk_temp: <1>Template:</1> Use the provided CSV format strictly.
books.bulk_val: <1>Validation:</1> The system pre-validates data before committing to the database.
books.life_det_desc: Track individual copy status (Available, Damaged, Lost) and view borrowing history.
books.life_acc_desc: Assign unique Accession Numbers to each physical copy of a title.

students.title: Student Management
students.desc: Manage your library's patrons efficiently. The <1>Student Module</1> handles registration, academic progression, and digital identity management.
students.dir_desc: A comprehensive searchable list of all registered members, color-coded by their active status.
students.step_data: <1>Essential Data:</1> Name, Register No (USN), and Role.
students.step_acad: <1>Academic Info:</1> Select Department and Current Semester.
students.bulk_desc: Designed for academic year initialization. Upload hundreds of student records in seconds.
students.bulk_pts: <1>Data Points:</1> Full Name, USN, Email, Phone, Dept, Sem.
students.id_desc: Generate professional, printable ID cards with QR codes for instant scanning at the circulation desk.
students.manage_desc: Click on any student row to view their full profile, borrowing history, and current fines.
students.edit_desc: Use the Edit icon to update semester or contact info.

departments.title: Department Management
departments.desc: The <1>Department Management</1> module is the structural backbone of the library, categorizing both books and members into distinct academic disciplines (e.g., Computer Science, Civil Engineering).
departments.dir_desc: The central hub for managing all academic branches. It provides a quick overview of active departments and their associated metadata.
departments.step_name: <1>Department Name:</1> Enter the full official name (e.g., "Computer Science & Engineering").
departments.step_code: <1>Short Code:</1> Assign a unique 2-4 letter code (e.g., "CS", "ME"). This code is used for generating Book IDs and Student Register Numbers.
departments.tip_code: <1>Pro Tip:</1> Use standard Short Codes (e.g., CIV, MEC, EEE) as these prefixes will appear on every Student ID card and Book Accession number linked to that department.
departments.edit_desc: Need to correct a typo or update a department name? Use the <1>Edit (Pencil)</1> icon on the department row.
departments.edit_note: <1>Note: Changing a Short Code will not retroactively update existing ID cards but will apply to all future registrations.</1>

circulation.title: Circulation Desk
circulation.desc: The <1>Circulation Desk</1> is the high-velocity hub for all loan transactions. Designed for speed, it supports barcode scanning and keyboard shortcuts to minimize mouse usage.
circulation.dash_desc: Three specialized tabs handle the core lifecycle of a borrowed item: Issue (Loan), Return (Check-in), and Fines form.
circulation.issue_step2: <1>Identify Patron:</1> Scan the Student ID card or type the Register Number.
circulation.issue_step3: <1>Identify Item:</1> Scan the Book's Accession Number (barcode).
circulation.issue_step4: <1>Verify & Commit:</1> The system checks for overdue books or fine blocks. Click <2>Issue Book</2> to confirm.
circulation.issue_tip: <1>Shortcut:</1> Press <2>Enter</2> after typing a number to instantly fetch details.
circulation.return_step3: <1>Auto-Calc:</1> The system calculates any late fees automatically.
circulation.return_step4: <1>Complete:</1> Click <2>Return Book</2>. If fines exist, a payment modal will appear.
circulation.fine_desc: The <1>Fines Tab</1> (<2>F3</2>) is a dual-purpose interface for collecting current dues and auditing past transactions.
circulation.collect_step1: Select a student with outstanding fines.
circulation.collect_step2: The system displays the total amount.
circulation.hist_desc: Track every penny. View a detailed ledger of all collected fines for a specific student, including dates and receipt IDs.
circulation.sec_desc: Every payment generates a unique SHA-256 digital signature.
circulation.verify_step1: Click the <1>Verify Receipt</1> button in the Fines/Transaction tab.
circulation.verify_step2: Enter the <1>Receipt ID</1> printed on the slip.
circulation.verify_step3: The system will validate the authenticity and show the original transaction details.

transactions.title: Transaction History
transactions.desc: The <1>Transaction History</1> module provides a transparent, immutable ledger of all financial operations within the library. It is essential for daily reconciliation and audit compliance.
transactions.log_desc: A chronological feed of every payment collected. The list updates in real-time as fines are settled at the Circulation Desk.
transactions.inspect_step1: Click on any row in the history table.
transactions.inspect_step2: <1>Receipt Preview:</1> View the digital receipt exactly as it was generated.
transactions.inspect_step3: <1>Metadata:</1> Check the Timestamp, Cashier (Admin Name), and Payment Mode.
transactions.inspect_step4: <1>Status:</1> Verify if the payment was successful or voids.
transactions.share_desc: Need to share data with the accounts department?
transactions.filter_data: <1>Filter Data:</1> Use the date picker to select a specific range (e.g., "This Month").
transactions.one_click: <1>One-Click Export:</1> Download the filtered view as a structured CSV or Excel file.
transactions.daily_sum: <1>Daily Summary:</1> Quickly see the total revenue for the selected period at the top of the screen.

reports.title: Reports & Analytics
reports.desc: The <1>Reports Module</1> transforms raw library data into actionable intelligence, helping you track circulation trends, inventory health, and member engagement.
reports.daily_desc: Start your day with a snapshot of library operations. This report aggregates all check-in/check-out events, new registrations, and fine collections for the current day.
reports.metric_1: <1>Most Issued Books:</1> Identify popular titles to plan procurement.
reports.metric_2: <1>Peak Hours:</1> Understand when the library is busiest.
reports.metric_3: <1>Departmental Usage:</1> See which branches are utilizing resources the most.
reports.custom_desc: Need data for a meeting? Generate professional grade reports in seconds.
reports.format_pdf: <1>PDF:</1> Perfect for printing and official presentations. Includes charts and summaries.
reports.format_excel: <1>Excel/CSV:</1> Ideal for raw data analysis and external auditing.

staff.title: Staff Management
staff.desc: The <1>Staff Management</1> module allows you to delegate daily operations without compromising system security. Assign specific roles to librarians and assistants.
staff.dir_desc: View all registered staff members, their active status, and assigned roles.
staff.role_lib: <1>Librarian:</1> Full access to Catalog and Students.
staff.action_contact: <1>Update Contact:</1> Keep phone and email current for notifications.
staff.action_reset: <1>Reset Password:</1> Admin override for forgotten credentials.
staff.action_deactivate: <1>Deactivate:</1> Suspend access for former employees immediately.

admin.title: Admin Management
admin.desc: The <1>Admin Management</1> area is the command center of the application. Users here have unrestricted access to all modules, including system settings and financial audits.
admin.sec_warning: <1>Security Warning:</1> Only grant Admin access to trusted senior personnel. Admins can permanently delete records.
admin.new_step2: <1>Identity:</1> Enter full name and official email.
admin.new_step4: <1>Audit:</1> Action is logged in the System Audit Trail.
admin.mod_desc: You can update contact details or change passwords. <1>Note: You cannot delete the Super Admin (Root) account.</1>

audit.title: Audit Logs
audit.desc: The <1>Audit Log</1> is an immutable record of every critical action taken within the system. It serves as the primary tool for security monitoring and forensic analysis.
audit.monitor_desc: The dashboard provides a real-time feed of system events. Each entry includes:
audit.actor: <1>Actor:</1> The staff member or admin who performed the action.
audit.target: <1>Target:</1> The record that was affected (e.g., Book Title: "Clean Code").
audit.timestamp: <1>Timestamp:</1> Precise date and time of the event.
audit.export_desc: For external audits or incident investigations, you can export the full log history.
audit.format: <1>Format:</1> High-fidelity CSV export compatible with Excel and other forensic tools.
audit.scope: <1>Scope:</1> Exports include all historical data available in the system.

policies.title: System Policies
policies.desc: The <1>System Policies</1> module allows you to define the logic that governs the library's daily operations, from loan durations to penalty calculations.
policies.circ_desc: Configure how books are issued and returned. These settings apply globally to ensure consistency.
policies.max_books: <1>Max Books Per Student:</1> Limit the number of items a user can hold (e.g., 3 books).
policies.loan_period: <1>Loan Period:</1> Set the standard borrowing duration (e.g., 15 days).
policies.renew_limit: <1>Renewal Limit:</1> Define how many times a book can be renewed.
policies.fin_desc: Automate fine calculations to reduce manual errors and disputes.
policies.fine_amount: <1>Fine Amount:</1> Set the daily penalty for overdue items (e.g., ₹5/day).
policies.grace_period: <1>Grace Period:</1> (Optional) Buffer days before fines start accumulating.

settings.title: System Settings
settings.desc: The <1>System Settings</1> module is the control center for your library's infrastructure, security, and automation rules.
settings.theme: <1>Theme Mode:</1> Toggle between Light (Day) and Dark (Night) modes for visual comfort.
settings.lang: <1>Interface Language:</1> Select the system's primary display language.
settings.access: <1>Accessibility:</1> Adjust font scaling and contrast ratios for inclusive access.
settings.doctor: <1>Smart Device Doctor:</1> Run self-diagnostics to check scanner and printer health.
settings.scanner: <1>Barcode Scanner:</1> Configure HID/COM modes and prefix/suffix stripping.
settings.session: <1>Session Settings:</1> Configurable auto-logout timers for idle inactivity.
settings.cloud: <1>Cloud Database:</1> Manage MongoDB connection strings and clusters.
settings.backup: <1>Backup & Restore:</1> Create or restore snapshots of the library catalog.
settings.auto_backup: <1>Backup Automation:</1> Schedule daily/weekly auto-backups to local storage.
settings.cache: <1>Cache Control:</1> Clear application cache to resolve UI syncing issues.
settings.danger: <1>Danger Zone:</1> Factory reset and hard-delete operations (Requires Authorization).
settings.auto_fill: <1>Auto-Fill Metadata:</1> Fetch book details (ISBN) via Google Books API.
settings.bulk_photo: <1>Bulk Photo Management:</1> Upload student/staff photos zip archives.
settings.id_sig: <1>ID Card Signatures:</1> Upload digital signatures for automated ID generation.
settings.id_down: <1>Download ID Cards:</1> Batch export of generated student ID cards.
settings.smtp: <1>Service Provider:</1> Select SMTP presets (Gmail, Outlook, etc.).
settings.sender: <1>Sender Identity:</1> Configure the 'From' name and email address.
settings.test_mail: <1>Connectivity Test:</1> Send test emails to verify server reachability.

health.title: System Health
health.desc: Monitor the performance and status of the library server in real-time. The <1>System Health</1> dashboard provides critical insights into resource usage.
health.tip: <1>Pro Tip:</1> If system load remains high (> 90%) for extended periods, consider restarting the application to clear accumulated <2>cache memory</2>.

public.title: Public Pages
public.desc: The <1>Public Portal</1> acts as the face of the library for visitors and students before they log in.
public.landing_desc: The welcome screen featuring the library motto and quick access links.
public.hero: Hero Section: <1>Welcoming banner with Institution branding.</1>
public.stats: Live Stats: <1>Ticker showing total books and active members.</1>
public.nav: Navigation: <1>Links to About Us, Login, and Contact.</1>

mongodb.title: Database Setup (Atlas)
mongodb.heading: Setting up MongoDB Atlas (Cloud Database)
mongodb.intro: This application uses a cloud database to store your data safely. Follow these steps to create your free database and connect it to the application.
mongodb.tip_cloud_desc: Your data is backed up automatically and accessible from anywhere (if you enable it).
mongodb.step1_desc: Go to <1>mongodb.com</1> and sign up for a free account.
mongodb.step2_li2: Choose a provider (AWS/Google/Azure) and a region close to you (e.g., Mumbai, Singapore).
mongodb.step2_li3: Click <1>Create Cluster</1>. (It takes 1-3 minutes to provision).
mongodb.step3_a_li1: Go to <1>Database Access</1> on the left sidebar.
mongodb.warn_network: This step is required for the application to connect from your college network.
mongodb.step3_b_li1: Go to <1>Network Access</1> on the left sidebar.
mongodb.step3_b_li3: <1>IMPORTANT:</1> Select <2>"Allow Access from Anywhere"</2> or enter <3>0.0.0.0/0</3> in the IP Address field.
mongodb.step4_li1: Go back to <1>Database</1> (Clusters) on the left.
mongodb.step4_li2: Click the <1>Connect</1> button on your cluster.
mongodb.step4_li4: Copy the connection string shown. It looks like:
mongodb.step4_li5: Replace <1><password></1> with the password you created in Step 3A.
mongodb.final_step: Paste this final string into the application's <1>Setup Page</1>.

smtp.title: Email Setup (Gmail App Password)
smtp.heading: Setting up Email Notifications (SMTP)
smtp.intro: To send OTPs and alerts, the application needs permission to send emails on your behalf. Since your main password is not secure for apps, Google requires an 'App Password'.
smtp.step1_desc: Go to your <1>Google Account</1> -> <2>Security</2> tab. Enable <3>2-Step Verification</3> if it is not already on.
smtp.step2_desc: In the search bar at the top of the security page, type <1>'App Passwords'</1> and select it.
smtp.step4_desc: You will see a 16-character code in a yellow bar (e.g., <1>abcd efgh ijkl mnop</1>).
smtp.step4_action: Copy this code (without spaces) and paste it into the <1>Application Settings</1> -> <2>Communication System</2> -> <3>Sender Password</3> field.
